content.p: "We are a multi-disciplinary centre advancing understanding of perinatal health. Our team includes scientists, obstetricians, neonatologists, clinical trialists, epidemiologists, statisticians, midwives, paediatricians, psychologists, engineers, computer scientists, researchers and support staff." Professor Don Sharkey, Director Centre for Perinatal Research. We do internationally leading research that delivers impact to improve the health outcomes relating to pregnancy, birth and the newborn periods. Our themes span the pre-conception period, through pregnancy, birth and into the neonatal period including longer term outcomes. We welcome and train postgraduates to be the best researchers of tomorrow, and have expertise in fundamental developmental science, randomised controlled trials, observational and epidemiological studies, newborn care and outcomes. We teach across all years of undergraduate and postgraduate courses. We have a substantial programme of training students in the area perinatal research including those from a scientific and clinical background. Online dashboard for outcomes in premature infants born below 32 weeks gestation
